form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Sanders (for himself, Mrs. Boxer, and Mr. Markey) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To amend the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 to provide for consultation with State and local governments, the consideration of State and local concerns, and the approval of post-shutdown decommissioning activities reports by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Nuclear Plant Decommissioning Act of 2015.
Chapter 10 of title I of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 (42 U.S.C. 2131 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: the host State of a covered facility; and
each State that is within 50 miles of a covered facility.

paragraph.text: The term Commission means the Nuclear Regulatory Commission.
The term covered facility means a facility of a licensee for which a PSDAR is required.
The term host State means the State in which a covered facility is located.
The term licensee has the meaning given the term in section 50.2 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation).

The term PSDAR means a post-shutdown decommissioning activities report submitted to the Commission and affected States under section 50.82(a)(4)(i) of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation).

subsection.text: A licensee shall develop a proposed PSDAR for a covered facility after consultation with—

paragraph.text: each unit of local government and tribal government in the affected State that is located within 50 miles of the covered facility.
After additional consultation with the entities described in subsection (b) with respect to the proposed PSDAR developed under that subsection, the licensee shall—

subparagraph.text: submit to the Commission the proposed PSDAR; and
on submission of the proposed PSDAR under subparagraph (A), make the proposed PSDAR readily available to the public.

paragraph.text: On receipt of the proposed PSDAR under paragraph (1), the Commission shall make the proposed PSDAR readily available to the public, on the condition that the Commission may redact any information necessary to protect the national security.

subsection.text: During a period of at least 90 days beginning on the date on which the licensee submits the proposed PSDAR to the Commission under subsection (c), the Commission shall solicit public participation on the proposed PSDAR in the host State, including through—

paragraph.text: the solicitation of written comments from the public; and
the conduct of at least 2 public hearings within the host State.

subsection.header: Support or nonsupport by host State

paragraph.text: Not later than 60 days after the receipt of a proposed PSDAR for a covered facility, the Commission shall notify the host State of the opportunity to file with the Commission, by the date that is 60 days after the date on which the host State receives the invitation under this paragraph—

subparagraph.text: a statement of support for the proposed PSDAR;
a statement of conditional support for the proposed PSDAR, with specific recommendations for changes that could lead the host State to support the proposed PSDAR; or
a statement of nonsupport for the proposed PSDAR.

paragraph.header: Statement of support or nonsupport; failure to submit

subparagraph.text: If the host State files a statement of support under paragraph (1)(A), a statement of nonsupport under paragraph (1)(C), or fails to file a statement with the Commission by the deadline specified in paragraph (1), the Commission shall issue a determination on whether the proposed PSDAR is adequate or inadequate—

clause.text: based on the considerations described in subparagraph (B); and

subclause.text: any written comments submitted by the host State, other States, and local communities with respect to the proposed PSDAR; and
any input from the public under subsection (d).

subparagraph.text: The Commission shall consider a proposed PSDAR to be adequate under subparagraph (A) if the Commission determines that—

clause.text: the proposed PSDAR provides for the overall protection of human health and the environment;
the licensee has a substantial likelihood of implementing the proposed PSDAR within the timeframe described in the proposed PSDAR;
the proposed PSDAR is in accordance with applicable law (including regulations); and
the licensee has demonstrated that the licensee has, or will have, the funds required to fully implement the proposed PSDAR within the timeframe described in the proposed PSDAR.

subparagraph.text: If the Commission determines that the proposed PSDAR is adequate under subparagraphs (A) and (B), the Commission shall issue a decision document approving the PSDAR.
If the Commission determines that the proposed PSDAR is inadequate under subparagraphs (A) and (B)—

clause.text: the Commission shall issue a decision rejecting the proposed PSDAR, including the reasons for the decision; and
not later than 2 years after the date on which operations at the plant cease, the licensee shall develop and submit to the Commission a new proposed PSDAR in accordance with this section.

subparagraph.text: The Commission shall determine whether the proposed PSDAR is permissible under applicable law (including regulations) if the host State files a statement of conditional support for the proposed PSDAR with the Commission in accordance with paragraph (1)(B).
For each change recommended by the host State under paragraph (1)(B), the Commission shall—

clause.text: provide for the inclusion of the change into the final PSDAR, unless the Commission determines the change to be inappropriate for inclusion, based on clear and convincing evidence provided by the licensee that—

subclause.text: the change violates applicable law; or
the costs of the change substantially outweigh the safety, economic, or environmental benefits of the change to the host State; and

clause.text: provide the rationale for a determination of inappropriateness under clause (i).
Based on the determinations made under subparagraphs (A) and (B), the Commission shall issue a decision document that—

subclause.text: accepts the proposed PSDAR with any changes recommended by the host State that are not determined to be inappropriate under subparagraph (B); or

clause.text: A decision document issued under clause (i) shall be considered to be a final order entered in a proceeding under section 189(a).

subparagraph.text: If the Commission approves the proposed PSDAR under subparagraph (C)(i)(I)—

clause.text: the licensee may begin implementation of the PSDAR.

subparagraph.text: If the Commission rejects the proposed PSDAR under subparagraph (C)(i)(II), not later than 2 years after the date on which operations at the plant cease, the licensee shall develop and submit to the Commission a new proposed PSDAR in accordance with this section.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, a Commission shall not approve a PSDAR under this section unless the proposed PSDAR includes a requirement that the licensee comply with applicable State law relating to air, water, or soil quality or radiological standards with respect to the implementation of the proposed PSDAR if the applicable State law is more restrictive than the applicable Federal law.

subparagraph.text: each licensee of the opportunity to develop a revised PSDAR for any facility of the licensee for which a PSDAR has been submitted but, as of the date of enactment of the Nuclear Plant Decommissioning Act of 2015—

clause.text: decontamination and dismantlement activities have not commenced; or
decontamination and dismantlement activities have been commenced for less than 1 year; and

subparagraph.text: each State that is within 50 miles of the facility described in subparagraph (A) of the opportunity consult with the licensee described in subparagraph (A) in accordance with subsection (b).

Except as provided in paragraphs (3) and (4), if a licensee described in paragraph (1) elects to develop a revised PSDAR, the process for consideration and approval of the revised PSDAR under paragraph (1) shall be carried out in accordance with—

clause.text: the process for the consideration and approval of a proposed PSDAR for covered facilities described in subsections (b) through (d) and subsection (f); and
the process for support or nonsupport by the host State as described in subsection (e).

subparagraph.text: If a licensee described in paragraph (1) elects not to revise the original PSDAR, the entities described in subsection (b) may file a statement of support or nonsupport for the original PSDAR in accordance with the process for support or nonsupport by the host State described in subsection (e).

paragraph.text: A decision document for a revised PSDAR submitted under this subsection, or for the original PSDAR if the licensee elects not to revise the original PSDAR, shall be carried out in accordance with subsection (e)(3)(C), except that the deadline for the Commission to issue a decision document shall be by not later than 1 year after the decontamination and dismantlement activities have commenced.

If the Commission rejects the revised PSDAR in accordance with the process for rejection under subsection (e)(3)(E), the licensee shall develop and submit to the Commission a new revised PSDAR in accordance with this subsection by not later than 2 years after the date on which the Commission rejects the revised PSDAR.
